quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Input[/h1]

To get input from the user in Ruby, you use the [b]gets [/b]method, which returns what the user types as a string. To store the input for later use, you can assign the return value to a variable.
[b]For example: [/b][code format="rb" codeId="985"]x = [b]gets[/b]
puts x[/code]
[b]gets [/b]gets a line of text, including the new line at the end. If you do not want to include the new line, use the [b]gets.chomp[/b] method: [code format="rb" codeId="986"]puts "Enter your name"
name = [b]gets.chomp[/b]
puts "Welcome, #{name}"[/code]
[note]The value of the input is a string. To convert it to an integer, you can use the [b]gets.to_i[/b] method.[/note]
